page.title: 16WATER SPORTS
page.content: Surfing is a wide spread sport in Jersey now. The surf is classed as one of the best in Europe.The Jersey wave is mostly a shortboard wave, but on "big days", occurring occasionally, large boards called{guns}are used. Quite a few world championships have been held in Jersey. Sailboarding or Windsurfing is also a growing sport as there is always a beach not far away. On windy days when there is no surf, sail boards can be seen doing 20 knots across the bay. For this, a long board with a large sail is used. On a choppy rough day when the surf is up, a shorter board and sail are used for wave jumping. This is hitting the wave just before it breaks and going about 10 feet in the air. Low pressure and north_westerly winds ensure perfect surfing conditions.
